result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 10:39 AM Defendant Remington Jon Nystrom in court.  Attorney Kirk Bowden Obear in court for Remington Jon Nystrom.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. The parties advise that the matter is not resolved and they are prepared to proceed to trial. Court addresses the State's motions in limine. No objection by Atty O'Bear. Court grants the State's motions in limine. Court addresses defense motion in limine. DA Leusink makes a statement regarding the defense motions in limine. The Court holds in abeyance any ruling on paragraphs 6, 12 & 15c. The Court does not grant paragraph 9.  The Court makes a statement regarding 15h. The Court grants the balance of the defense motions in limine.  Court addresses 906.09 motion filed by the State. Statement by Attorney Obear - no objection. Court makes statement and instructs defendant regarding impeachment-answer is yes, and correct number is 2.  Court further instructs defendant regarding answer and consequences of answer-Defendant states the instructions are understood. The parties advise that there will be no expert testimony at trial. The Court reviews the jury instructions with counsel. The Court addresses the State's motions for admission of other acts. Argument by DA Leusink. Argument by Atty O'Bear. Atty O'Bear requesting the opportunity to brief the matter. The Court orders that Atty O'Bear file his response to the State's motions for admission of other acts by December 20, 2022. The Court will schedule an adjourned FPT to address the other acts motion and any other FPT issues. The Court will allow Atty O'Bear and the defendant to appear by phone at the FPT. FPT/JT scheduled - NOH given.
Jury trial scheduled for April 12, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 01:45 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 11:33 AM Defendant Remington Jon Nystrom appeared in court with Attorney Kirk Bowden Obear. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Detective Sergeant Jason Christenson sworn in for testimony. Direct exam by DA Leusink. Witness identifies the defendant. Cross exam by Atty Obear. Witness excused. The Court finds probable cause. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived. NG plea entered. STC scheduled - NOH given.
Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:25 am.
Status conference on April 5, 2022 at 09:25 am.

Defendant to comply with all conditions of probation. Defendant is prohibited from having contact with any persons under the age of 18 unless they are in the immediate presence of a parent or guardian. Defendant to comply with the Sex Offender Registration Program. Defendant is prohibited from having contact with the Mount Morris Camp.

Case called @ 1:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Wesley J Kottke appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Remington Jon Nystrom appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Kirk Bowden Obear appeared by phone for Remington Jon Nystrom. Victim appears telephonically. Defendant waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. Bond argument by ADA Kottke. Bond argument by Atty Obear. Court orders $5000 Cash Bond. The defendant requests a PH be scheduled. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.
